results.title: The English patient [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Miramax Films, Saul Zaentz and Anthony Minghella
results.brief_description: Based on Michael Ondaatje’s Booker prize-winning novel, “The English Patient” is a sumptuous romance set during the second world war in the deserts of North Africa and the rolling hills of Tuscany. Hana (Juliette Binoche), a shell-shocked Canadian nurse decides to stay in an abandoned villa to nurse a mysterious English patient (Ralph Fiennes) who is burned beyond recognition and doesn’t remember his name. Gradually we learn the truth of his identity and of his doomed love affair with Katherine Mansfield (Kristen Scott Thomas). (Awards: Winner of 9 Oscars at the 1996 Academy Awards, including Best Film, Best Director, Best Supporting Actress - Juliette Binoche and Best Cinematography for Australian John Seale)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Miramax Films, Saul Zaentz and Anthony Minghella

results.title: The End of violence
results.creator_credit: Ciby Pictures, Road Movies, Kintop Pictures, Deepak Nayar, Nicholas Klein and Wim Wenders
results.brief_description: Mike Max (Bill Pullman) is a leading Hollywood producer, whose triumph has come from a string of extremely violent action films. His work is his life, and he neglects his wife Paige (Andie MacDowell) in his pursuit of success. Paige, frustrated with his lack of attention, leaves him, and Max is forced to admit he was a less-than supportive husband. Not long after, Max becomes involved in a violent killing, and fearing for his life, goes into hiding, falling victim to a new top-secret surveillance system, which caught the crime on camera. Escaping into L.A.’s underworld, Max confronts a violence more terrifying than anything he could put on film. Directed by Wim Wenders (Wings of desire; Faraway so close; Paris, Texas) ‘The End of Violence’ is a tale of conspiracy, the effects of violence in our culture, and personal transformation. Cast includes Traci Lind, Rosiland Chao, Gabriel Byrne, Udo Kier, Frederic Forrest and director Samuel Fuller. The film’s score was composed by Ry Cooder.

results.title: The End of the affair
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Stephen Woolley and Neil Jordan
results.brief_description: During the Second World War, English novelist Maurice Bendrix (Ralph Fiennes) conducted a five year, illicit affair with a married woman (Julianne Moore). Embittered and bewildered by his lover’s abrupt disappearance after a bomb attack, Maurice has the opportunity to re-enter Sarah’s life after he encounters her husband, Henry (Stephen Rea), shortly after the war. Henry, who maintains a platonic relationship with his wife, suspects that she is having an affair and appeals to Maurice to help him find the truth. Overwhelmed by jealousy, Maurice enlists the services of a private detective on the pretext that he is helping Henry. As the film flashes between the present and the past, the motives for Sarah’s actions are gradually revealed. Graham Greene denied that his novel was based on his own affair with Catherine Walston, despite dedicating it to ‘C’ and giving Sarah’s husband the same name as Catherine’s husband. Cast includes Ian Hart and Jason Isaacs. Music composed and conducted by Michael Nyman. Editing, Tony Lawson. Cinematography, Roger Pratt. Written for the screen by Neil Jordan.

results.title: The Emperor and the assassin
results.creator_credit: New Wave Entertainmnet, Beijing Film Studio, Chen Kaige, Shirley Kao and Satoru Iseki
results.brief_description: The most expensive film produced in China at its date of production, this historical epic is based on the event of the forced unification of China in the third century. By 221 BC, after centuries of civil war, seven kingdoms were dominant in China. At this time the ruler of the kingdom of Qin, Ying Zheng (Li Xuejian), raised to believe he had an ancestral duty to unify all of China, undertook a brutal conquest to achieve his goal, thus becoming the country’s first emperor. In this interpretation Zheng is aided in his quest by his lover, Lady Zhao (Gong Li), who devises a fake assassination plot to justify an invasion of the neighboring kingdom of Yan, enlisting the help of Yan assassin Jing Ke (Zhang Fengyi) who is trying to give up his bloody past. As the King becomes increasingly ruthless and bloodthirsty, Lady Zhao shifts her political and romantic allegiances to the assassin. Filled with the back-stabbing imperial politics, murderous betrayals, acts of cruelty and bloody mass slaughter usually associated with Shakespearean tragedy, the emotional impact and tension of the complex narrative is at times dwarfed by the elaborately staged, large-scale battle sequences and the visual grandeur of the landscape. Written by Chen Kaige and Wang Peigong. Photography, Zhao Fei, music, Zhao Jiping.

results.title: The Emperor's new groove
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Randy Fullmer and Mark Dindal
results.brief_description: Emperor Kuzco is an arrogant and selfish leader and his latest plan involves destroying a hill top village to build a summer palace. He invites village elder Pancha in to discuss options, but only to find out the best place to get the sun. When the amnesiac emperor awakes to find himself turned into a llama, he blames the kindly Pancho, unaware that his conniving advisor, the wizened Yzma, and brawny brainless sidekick Kronk, have usurped his power. Demanding he be returned to the palace, Kuzco pushes Pancha’s faith that to the limit that all human beings possess goodness. Featuring the voices of David Spade, John Goodman, Eartha Kitt, Patrick Warburton, Wendie Malick and music by Tom Jones and Sting, this witty Disney animation espouses the virtues of friendship and kindness to others.

results.title: The Elephant man [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Brooksfilms, Jonathan Sanger and David Lynch
results.brief_description: Deformed at birth by a rare disease, penniless John Merrick is forced to become the star attraction in a travelling freak-show. Treves, a compassionate surgeon, rescues him from the fairground taunts, coaxing out of the terrified, disabled man a touchingly unembittered personality. This multi-award winning film stars Anthony Hopkins, John Hurt, John Gielgud and Anne Bancroft. Based on “The Elephant man and other reminiscences” by Sir Frederick Treves and in part on “The Elephant man: a study in human dignity” by Ashley Montagu. Cast includes John Hurt, Anthony Hopkins, Anne Bancroft, John Gielgud, Wendy Hiller

results.title: The Elementary school = Obecna skola
results.creator_credit: Filmove Studio Barrandov, Jaromir Lukas and Jan Sverak
results.brief_description: A new teacher begins work at an elementary school in a small Czechoslovakian town closely following the second World War. This situation provides an historical backdrop for the exploration of a dark period in Czechoslovakian history. Sverak’s debut feature, written by his father (Zdenek Sverak) was the last film to represent the united Czechoslovakia, in the Foreign Language Film category of the 1991 Oscars (it lost to Italy’s entry “Mediterraneo”). Cast includes Jan Triska and Libuse Safrankova. In Czech with English subtitles.

results.title: The Electric horseman
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures Corporation, Universal Pictures, Wildwood Enterprises, Ray Stark and Sydney Pollack
results.brief_description: When a has-been, drunken rodeo star reduced to starring in breakfast cereal advertisments finds out the multi-million dollar racehorse he is expected to ride for a publicity stunt has been drugged, he steals it, riding it out into the Nevada desert where it can recuperate. Seeing a good story, a newswoman (Jane Fonda) follows him, staying one step ahead of a posse of pursuing police. By the time they reach a remote rendezvous high in the Utah mountains, she is in love with both the cowboy and his convictions.
